snippet: Some players insist the $760 million proposed settlement by the N.F.L. is too small while others say that ailing former players need help now.
abstract: Doubts linger over NFL's proposed $760 settlement, with many former players insisting it is too small and that ailing former players need immediate payouts and medical benefits; key to settlement, which may not be available to those who choose to opt out, is that players will not have to prove current neurocognitive ailments were caused by concussions sustained during NFL play.
lead_paragraph: Some players insist the $760 million proposed settlement by the N.F.L. is too small while others say that ailing former players need help now.

headline.main: Doubts Linger Over N.F.L. Concussion Settlement
